h2. View info about gadget

To view info about current version of eXo _IDE_, please, click on *"Help->About"* top menu command.

h2. Customize Toolbar

If you want to customize toolbar - add or remove some buttons, change their positions or change delimiters - you can do it from the *"Customize toolbar"* dialog window. This dialog can be called by clicking on *"Window->Customize Toolbar..."* top menu item. This dialog have typical interface and command set for such operations:

!ide-customize_toolbar.png!
*Picture 27. Customize Toolbar*

h2. Hotkeys customization (since 1.0 beta2)

Hotkey manager supports hotkeys customization. If you use your hotkeys, that match to browser hotkeys, only eXo _IDE_ hotkeys will work out.

If you don't override browser hotkeys, they will work as usual.

You can customize hotkeys in *"Customize hotkeys"* dialog window. To call this dialog, you should call *"Window->Customize Hotkeys..."* top menu command.

!customize-hotkeys.png!
*Picture 28. Customize hotkeys*

*"Customize hotkeys"* dialog window consists of list grid with all commands divided on groups and their hotkeys, binding to them.
If you want to bind hotkey for some control:
# Select command in *"Customize hotkeys"* dialog window. After selection the focus will be set on *"Hotkey"* field.
# Press hotkeys combination. It should begins from "Ctrl" or "Alt" key + other allowed key.
# If hotkeys combination is valid, *"Bind"* button will be active. Otherwise the error message will be shown under the *"Hotkey"* field.
# Press *"Bind"* button.
# Press *"Save"* button to save your settings on the server, or *"Cancel"* button if you want to cancel changes.

If you entered invalid hotkeys combination, error message will be shown:

!customize-hotkeys-error.png!
*Picture 29. Error message*

If you want to unbind hotkeys from some command, you could:

# Open *"Customize hotkeys"* dialog window.
# Find needed command in list grid.
# Press *"Unbind"* button.
# Press *"Save"* button to save your settings on the server, or press *"Cancel"* button to cancel changes.

At the end of hotkeys list, you can see "Editor hotkeys" group. You can't change this hotkeys, because they are reserved and used in editors. Also you can't use this hotkeys for other commands. There are lists of predefined hotkeys:

h3. Default global hotkeys

* Ctrl+F - Find/Replace
* Ctrl+D - Delete line
* Ctrl+L - Go to line
* Ctrl+N - Create file from template
* Ctrl+S - Save file

h3. Non-changable hotkeys which work within the editors

* Ctrl+Space - Autocomplete
* Ctrl+B - Make text bold
* Ctrl+I - Make text italic
* Ctrl+U - Make text undeline
* Ctrl+C - Copy selected text
* Ctrl+V - Paste copied text
* Ctrl+X - Cut selected text
* Ctrl+Z - Undo typing
* Ctrl+Y - Redo typing
* Ctrl+A - Select all
* Ctrl+Home - Go to the start of document
* Ctrl+End - Go to the end of document
